Job Location:&nbsp;Wuye, Abuja (FCT)

Reports to: Managing Director
Level: Mid-Level (Experienced Professional)

Role Summary


	The Mid-Level Accountant will be responsible for managing day-to-day accounting operations, ensuring accurate financial reporting, supporting statutory and regulatory compliance, and contributing to effective financial management within the organization.
	The role requires a proactive professional who is current with modern accounting standards, tax regulations, and financial management practices, particularly within the real estate sector.


Key Responsibilities
Accounting &amp; Financial Management:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records, including ledgers, journals, and reconciliations.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and management reports.
	Manage cash flow, expense tracking, budgeting, and cost control.
	Monitor project-based accounting for real estate developments, sales, and rentals.
	Ensure proper documentation and accounting for property transactions, commissions, and related expenses.


Statutory &amp; Regulatory Compliance:


	Ensure full compliance with statutory obligations, including tax filings and remittances (PAYE, WHT, VAT, CIT, etc.).
	Liaise with tax authorities, auditors, and regulatory bodies as required.
	Support internal and external audits and ensure timely resolution of audit queries.
	Keep the organization up to date with changes in financial regulations, tax laws, and accounting standards.


Financial Controls &amp; Process Improvement:


	Implement and maintain effective internal controls to safeguard company assets.
	Review financial processes and recommend improvements for efficiency and accuracy.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, financial procedures, and best practices.
	Support the development and enforcement of financial policies and controls.


Reporting &amp; Decision Support:


	Provide financial insights and analysis to support management decision-making.
	Assist with financial forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis.
	Prepare reports required for management, investors, and other stakeholders.


Systems &amp; Tools:


	Use accounting software and ERP systems efficiently (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Zoho, or similar).
	Maintain accurate financial data and documentation using digital tools and spreadsheets.
	Stay current with evolving accounting technologies and reporting tools.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy and timeliness of financial reports
	Compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements
	Effectiveness of internal controls
	Budget adherence and cost management
	Audit outcomes and issue resolution


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	3 - 5 years of relevant accounting experience, preferably within real estate, construction, or a related industry.
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, or equivalent) is highly desirable or in progress.


Required Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of accounting principles and financial reporting standards.
	Sound understanding of Nigerian statutory and tax compliance requirements.
	Proven experience in financial management and reporting.
	High level of accuracy, attention to detail, and analytical skills.
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Excel.
	Strong organizational, time-management, and problem-solving skills.
	High level of integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.


Preferred Attributes:


	Experience in real estate sales, leasing, or project accounting
	Ability to handle multiple projects and deadlines
	Up-to-date knowledge of current accounting and tax developments.

Financial Accountant Job at Nik De Panache Limited




        
    

        
        Nik De Panache Limited is a real estate, life style, Investment and Construction Company incorporated in the year 2015. Nik De Panache was birthed out of passion to achieve excellence and deliver quality services to our clients in a panache manner. The name Nik De Panache is a combination of two words, Nik and Panache. Nik: is a suffix denoting a person associated with a specified quality Panache: flamboyant display of confidence and style. We prioritize with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) 2030 in providing sustainable real estate solutions for our esteemed clients. We operate based on this underlying principle in our efficient use of time and resources.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Financial Accountant
Job Location: Wuye, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: Managing Director
Level: Mid-Level (Experienced Professional)

Role Summary


	The Mid-Level Accountant will be responsible for managing day-to-day accounting operations, ensuring accurate financial reporting, supporting statutory and regulatory compliance, and contributing to effective financial management within the organization.
	The role requires a proactive professional who is current with modern accounting standards, tax regulations, and financial management practices, particularly within the real estate sector.


Key Responsibilities
Accounting & Financial Management:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records, including ledgers, journals, and reconciliations.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and management reports.
	Manage cash flow, expense tracking, budgeting, and cost control.
	Monitor project-based accounting for real estate developments, sales, and rentals.
	Ensure proper documentation and accounting for property transactions, commissions, and related expenses.


Statutory & Regulatory Compliance:


	Ensure full compliance with statutory obligations, including tax filings and remittances (PAYE, WHT, VAT, CIT, etc.).
	Liaise with tax authorities, auditors, and regulatory bodies as required.
	Support internal and external audits and ensure timely resolution of audit queries.
	Keep the organization up to date with changes in financial regulations, tax laws, and accounting standards.


Financial Controls & Process Improvement:


	Implement and maintain effective internal controls to safeguard company assets.
	Review financial processes and recommend improvements for efficiency and accuracy.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, financial procedures, and best practices.
	Support the development and enforcement of financial policies and controls.


Reporting & Decision Support:


	Provide financial insights and analysis to support management decision-making.
	Assist with financial forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis.
	Prepare reports required for management, investors, and other stakeholders.


Systems & Tools:


	Use accounting software and ERP systems efficiently (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Zoho, or similar).
	Maintain accurate financial data and documentation using digital tools and spreadsheets.
	Stay current with evolving accounting technologies and reporting tools.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy and timeliness of financial reports
	Compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements
	Effectiveness of internal controls
	Budget adherence and cost management
	Audit outcomes and issue resolution


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	3 - 5 years of relevant accounting experience, preferably within real estate, construction, or a related industry.
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, or equivalent) is highly desirable or in progress.


Required Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of accounting principles and financial reporting standards.
	Sound understanding of Nigerian statutory and tax compliance requirements.
	Proven experience in financial management and reporting.
	High level of accuracy, attention to detail, and analytical skills.
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Excel.
	Strong organizational, time-management, and problem-solving skills.
	High level of integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.


Preferred Attributes:


	Experience in real estate sales, leasing, or project accounting
	Ability to handle multiple projects and deadlines
	Up-to-date knowledge of current accounting and tax developments.
